footnotes.footnote: Based on the results of the 2021 Population Census.

Data in this table have been randomly adjusted to avoid the release of confidential data. No reliance should be placed on small numbers. Urban/Rural areas are based on Australian Statistical Geography Standard (ASGS): Volume 3. Urban includes Major Urban and Other Urban. Rural includes Bounded Locality Areas and Rural Balance.
Including population in off-shore, migratory and shipping.
Total population includes off-shore and migratory areas but excludes overseas visitors.
Excluding usual residents not in country at time of census.
These data have been randomly rounded to protect confidentiality. Individual figures may not add up to totals, and values for the same data may vary in different tables.
Based on the results of the 2016 Population Census.
Excluding visitors.
Mid-year estimates have been adjusted for underenumeration at latest census.

Excluding full-blooded aborigines estimated at 39 319 in June 1954, 40 081 in June 1961 and armed forces stationed outside country numbering 48 106 in May 1959. In 1966, data exclude persons describing themselves as being more than 50 per cent aboriginal or simply as aboriginal.
Projection of the population of Brazil and Federation Units by sex and age for the period 2010-2060.

Data include persons in remote areas, military personnel outside the country, merchant seamen at sea, civilian seasonal workers outside the country, and other civilians outside the country, and exclude nomads, foreign military, civilian aliens temporarily in the country, transients on ships and Indian jungle population.
Data refer to national projections.
Preliminary postcensal estimates.
Adjusted for census net undercoverage (including adjustment for incompletely enumerated Indian reserves).
Updated postcensal estimates.

To ensure confidentiality, the values, including totals are randomly rounded either up or down to a multiple of '5' or '10.' As a result, when these data are summed or grouped, the total value may not match the individual values since totals and sub-totals are independently rounded. Similarly, percentages, which are calculated on rounded data, may not necessarily add up to 100%.
Final postcensal estimates.
Final intercensal estimates.
Because of rounding, totals are not in all cases the sum of the respective components.
Data have not been adjusted for underenumeration.

For statistical purposes, the data for China do not include those for the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (Hong Kong SAR), Macao Special Administrative Region (Macao SAR) and Taiwan province of China.
Data have been estimated on the basis of the annual National Sample Survey on Population Changes.
Data are from Communique of the National Bureau of Statistics of the People's Republic of China on Major Figures of the 2010 Population Census (No.1).
Data refer to the civilian population of 31 provinces, municipalities and autonomous regions.
Data have been adjusted on the basis of the Population Census of 2000.
For statistical purposes, the data for China do not include those for the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region (Hong Kong SAR).
Data have been adjusted on the basis of the Population Census of 1990.
Covering only the civilian population of 29 provinces municipalities and autonomous regions.
Data have been taken from the statistics of household registration.

Population registered. Figure for total population includes an estimate of 7 591 298 for Taiwan Province and 8 397 477 for persons living in outlying areas where local registration offices were not established. No adjustment has been made for 0.1 per cent estimated net underenumeration. Source: Communique issued 1 November 1954 by the State Statistical Bureau concerning the result of the National Population Census and Registration, published in Jen-min Jih-pao (People's Daily), Beijing, 1 November 1954.
Excluding diplomatic personnel outside the country and including members of alien armed forces not living in military camps and foreign diplomatic personnel not living in embassies or consulates.
Data include Overseas Departments.
Excluding military personnel stationed outside the country who do not have a personal residence in France.
Based on the results of the 2011 Population Census.
Data refer to annual average population.
Excluding homeless persons.
Excluding foreign military personnel and foreign diplomatic and consular personnel and their family members in the country.
Data of the microcensus - a 1 per cent household sample survey - refer to a single reference week in spring (usually last week in April).
Data are projections based on the 2011 Population Census.
Includes data for the Indian-held part of Jammu and Kashmir, the final status of which has not yet been determined.
Data refer to projections based on the 2001 Population Census.

Excluding Mao-Maram, Paomata and Purul sub-divisions of Senapati district of Manipur. The population of Manipur including the estimated population of the three sub-divisions of Senapati district is 2,291,125 (Males 1,161,173 and females 1,129,952).
Excluding estimated population for Mao Maram, Paomata and Purul sub-divisions of Senapati district of Manipur.
Interpolated population for Jammu and Kashmir.
Data are based on Indonesia population census of 2020 and population projection for 2020-2050.
Data are based on the publication: "Indonesia Population Projection 2015-2045"
Data are based on the publication: "Indonesia Population Projection 2010-2035"
Data are based on the publication: "Indonesia Population Projection 2005-2015"
Data refer to the "Intercensal Population Survey".
Excluding Province Nanggroe Aceh Darussalam, Regency Nias & Nias Selatan, Regency Boven Digul & Teluk Wondama.
Data are based on the publication: "Trends of Selected Socio-Economic Indicators of Indonesia"

The figure includes an estimated population of 459 557 persons in urban and 1 857 659 persons in rural areas that were not directly enumerated, and a population of 566 403 persons in urban and 1 717 578 persons in rural areas that decline the participation. Also included are 421 399 non permanent residents (the homeless, the crew of ships carrying national flag, boat/floating house people, remote located tribesmen and refugees.)
Data provided by Indonesia include East Timor.
Data refer to combination of de jure and de facto population.
Based on a 5 per cent sample of census returns.
Excluding West Irian.
Postcensal estimates.
Data refer to usual resident population.
Excluding diplomatic personnel outside the country and foreign military and civilian personnel and their dependants stationed in the area.
Estimates or projections based on the 2020 population census.

For the 2020 census, urban areas are “Densely Inhabited Districts”, defined as areas within a municipality that is composed of a group of contiguous Basic Unit Blocks, each of which has a population density of 4,000 inhabitants or more per square kilometer and whose total population exceeds 5,000 as of 1 October 2020. The detailed methodological explanation is available at https://www.stat.go.jp/english/data/chiri/did/1-1.html
Estimates or projections based on the 2015 population census.
Data refer to Japanese nationals in Japan only.
Excluding Tokara Archipelago and Amami Islands, not under the administration of Japan after 2 September 1945 but which reverted to Japan on 5 December 1951 ad 25 December 1953 respectively.
The population projections of CONAPO (National Population Council).
Including an estimation of 6 337 751 persons corresponding to 1 588 422 housing units without information of the occupants.
Data revised by CONAPO (National Population Council).
Including an estimation of 1 334 585 persons corresponding to 448 195 housing units without information of the occupants.
Data refer to registered resident population.
Census results based on compilation of continuous accounting and sample surveys.
Data include both Koreans and foreigners. De jure residence refers to expected length of stay of more than three months.
Excluding usual residents not in the country at the time of census.
Including diplomats and their families abroad, but excluding foreign diplomats, foreign military personnal, and their families in the country.
Excluding foreigners.
Based on Korean Civil Registration System.
Excluding alien armed forces, civilian aliens employed by armed forces, foreign diplomatic personnel and their dependants and Korean diplomatic personnel and their dependants outside the country.
Data refer to the Republic of Korea nationals in the Republic of Korea only.
Information provided by the Russian Federation. Includes statistical data for the Autonomous Republic of Crimea and the city of Sevastopol, Ukraine, temporarily occupied by the Russian Federation.
Figures were updated taking into account the results of the 2002 All-Russian population census.
Based on the results of the 2022 Population Census.
Excluding transients visitors.
Based on the results of the 'Evolución de la Población de España entre los Censos de 1981 y 1991'.
Based on the results of the 'Evolución de la Población de España entre los Censos de 1970 y 1981'.
Based on the results of the 'Evolución de la Población Española en el período 1961-1978'.
Data refer to legal resident population.
Data refer to the permanent resident population at the main place of residence.
Data based on Address Based Population Registration System.
Based on a sample taken at the time of census.
Excluding Channel Islands (Guernsey and Jersey) and Isle of Man, shown separately, if available.

Usual residents in England, Wales and Northern Ireland were defined as persons who have been living in the United Kingdom or intend to stay in the United Kingdom for 12 months or more. Usual residents in Scotland are those whose total length of stay in the UK has been or will be six months or more.
Counts for the 2001 Census are taken from 'Key Statistics table 1 for the Urban/Rural classification: England and Wales' available on CD based on the usually resident population.
Counts for the 1991 Census are taken from 'Key Statistics for Urban and Rural Areas: Great Britain 1991' published volume based on the usually resident population.
Excluding Northern Ireland.
Counts from the 1981 Census are taken from 'Key Statistics for Urban Areas: Great Britain 1981' published volume based on the usually resident population.
Counts from the 1971 Census are taken from the 'Age, Marital Condition and General Tables' published volume and are based on persons present.
Data refer to resident population.
Excluding U.S. Armed Forces overseas and civilian U.S. citizens whose usual place of residence is outside the United States.
Data refer to the resident population for the 50 states and the District of Columbia.
Inter-censal estimates.
Including armed forces overseas.
